summary: Coatis, also called coatimundis, are animals from South and Central America, Mexico, and the U.S. They belong to the Procyonidae family. These diurnal mammals have a unique name that originates from the Tupian languages of Brazil, meaning "lone coati." In Belize, they are often referred to as "quash." Coatis are part of the Nasuina subtribe, with two main genera: *Nasua* and *Nasuella*.
title: Coati
